translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories
. The Elder Who Gave All Kinds of Fruit
“My name was Varuṇa,
a brahmin who had mastered the mantras;
I abandoned my ten children
and went to live in the middle of the forest.
Having made a well-built hermitage,
well-arranged and delightful,
having made a leaf hut,
I lived in the wilderness.
Padumuttara, the knower of the world,
the receiver of offerings,
desiring to rescue me,
came to my hermitage.
As far as the forest grove,
there was great radiance;
by the Buddha’s power,
the wilderness blazed then.
Having seen that miracle
of the best Buddha, the patient one,🔽taking a bowl full of fruit,
I made an offering with the fruit.

analyzed: upagantvāna sambuddha  saha khāri mada asaha
translated: Having approached the Fully Enlightened One,🔽I offered a load of wood.
Out of compassion for me, the Buddha
spoke this statement:
‘Taking a load of wood,
come behind me.
When the Saṅgha has eaten,
there will be merit for you.’
Taking a piece of broken (pottery),
I gave it to the Community of monks;
There I had confidence in my mind,
and was reborn in the Tusita heaven.
There with divine dances,

analyzed: gītehi vāditehi ca  puñña kammena sayutta
translated: songs, and music,🔽I experience constant happiness,
connected with my meritorious deeds.

analyzed: yam yam yonupapajjāmi  devattam atha mānusa
translated: Whatever womb I enter,🔽whether it be divine or human,
I have no lack of wealth,
this is the fruit of giving the fruit.
As far as the four continents,
with the ocean and the mountains,
having given the Buddha the fruit,
I rule as a monarch.
As far as the flocks of birds,
if they fly up into the sky,
they also come to me for protection,
this is the fruit of giving the fruit.
As far as the forest grove,
yakkhas, bhūtas, and rākṣasas,
kumbhaṇḍas, garuḷas, and so on,
come to me for protection.
Scorpions, snakes, bees,
mosquitoes, and gadflies,
they also come to me for protection,
this is the fruit of giving the fruit.
Birds called Supaṇṇas,
who have wings and are very strong,
They too go to me for refuge,
this is the fruit of giving fruit.
Even the long-lived Nāgas,
who have psychic power and great majesty,
They too come to me for protection,
this is the fruit of giving fruit.
Lions, tigers, leopards,
peacocks, and partridges,
They too come to me for protection,
this is the fruit of giving fruit.
Medicinal herbs, grasses, and trees,
and those who live in the sky,
All go to me for refuge,
this is the fruit of giving fruit.
Very hard to see, very subtle,
deep, and well-taught,
Having experienced it I live,
this is the fruit of giving fruit.
Having touched the eight liberations,
I live without pollutants.
I am ardent and discerning,
this is the fruit of giving fruit.
Those Buddha-sons who have attained the fruit,
who have destroyed faults and have great majesty,
I am just one of them,
this is the fruit of giving fruit.
Having attained perfection in direct knowledge,
urged on by the root of merit,
Having fully understood all pollutants,
I live without pollutants.
Having attained the three knowledges and psychic powers,
the Buddha’s sons of great splendor;
I attained the divine ear,
and I am one of them.
For a hundred thousand eons,
the fruit I gave then,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving the fruit.
My defilements are burned up,
I dwell without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
The four analytical insights,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sabbaphaladāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā sabbaphaladāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus did the venerable Sabbaphaladāyaka recite these verses.
The Story of the Elder Sabbaphaladāyaka is the ninth.
